title: Tournament Setup - Valid Size and Filter Selection
description: Verify the user can select valid tournament sizes and dietary filters and the selections are accepted without errors.

steps.description: Open the Tournament Setup screen
Select each available tournament size option individually
Apply different combinations of dietary filters (e.g. vegetarian, gluten-free, dairy-free)
Ensure the size and filter selections are displayed correctly and no error messages appear

title: Tournament Setup - Invalid or Edge Filter Combinations
description: Test edge cases where dietary filters exclude all or most foods to confirm graceful handling.

steps.description: Open Tournament Setup screen
Apply dietary filters combination that excludes all foods from dataset
Verify user is notified of no available foods or the UI disables starting the tournament

title: Tournament Game - Bracket Progression and Battle Animations
description: Validate bracket-style tournament progresses correctly through all rounds with animated battle cards.

steps.description: Start a tournament with default size and no filters
Check initial bracket and food pairings shown correctly
Select winners repeatedly to progress through each round
Observe battle cards animate smoothly between rounds with no rendering glitches
Ensure tournament proceeds until final winner is determined

title: Result Screen - Display Winner with Full Contentful Data
description: Verify the Result Screen shows winner's image, recipe, history, and sensory map when Contentful CMS data is available.

steps.description: Complete a tournament with a food item known to have complete Contentful data
Result Screen loads winner's image correctly
Verify Recipe, History, and Sensory Map sections are displayed with correct content
Check confetti animation triggers once upon displaying results
Confirm dark theme styling is applied consistently on the Result Screen

title: Result Screen - Handle Missing Contentful Data Gracefully
description: Ensure the Result Screen fallback UI displays when Contentful CMS returns no data for winner.

steps.description: Complete a tournament with a food item known to have missing Contentful CMS content
Verify fallback content is shown for missing recipe, history, and sensory map
Confirm no broken images or blank fields are present
Verify confetti animation still triggers on winner display

title: Contentful CMS Integration - API Success Handling
description: Test that the Contentful API calls succeed and data is fetched and rendered accurately on Result Screen.

steps.description: Mock API success response with rich food content
Navigate to Result Screen for the mocked food item
Check that recipe, history, and sensory map data are displayed as per API response

title: Contentful CMS Integration - API Failure and Timeout
description: Verify that API failures or timeouts are handled gracefully with fallback UI and error messages.

steps.description: Simulate Contentful API failure or timeout when loading Result Screen
Ensure fallback content is shown and UI remains responsive
Verify appropriate error notifications or messages are displayed to the user

title: Deep Linking - Result Screen loads correct winner data
description: Validate that accessing deep links (e.g. /result/FoodName) loads the accurate winner data and UI.

steps.description: Navigate directly to /result/{foodName} with a valid food name in URL
Confirm winner data loads correctly from Contentful or fallback UI is shown if data missing
Verify page adheres to dark theme styling

title: UI Dark Theme Consistency and Responsiveness
description: Verify the entire application UI consistently applies dark theme styling and is responsive across screen sizes.

steps.description: Visit Tournament Setup, Tournament Game, and Result screens on desktop resolution
Check all UI elements adhere to dark theme color palette
Resize viewport to various mobile and tablet sizes
Verify UI elements remain legible and accessible with no overlap or clipping

title: Navigation - Seamless navigation between screens and browser history support
description: Ensure React Router-based navigation works smoothly including forward, back, and deep links.

steps.description: Navigate from Tournament Setup to Tournament Game screen after configuration
Progress through a tournament and navigate to Result Screen
Use browser back and forward buttons to navigate between screens
Verify application state and data reflect correct screens without errors
Access deep link URLs for result pages directly
Confirm correct screen loads with proper data and UI

title: Tournament Game - Edge Case Handling with Minimum and Maximum Sizes
description: Test starting tournaments at minimum and maximum allowed sizes to verify smooth gameplay and UI stability.

steps.description: Select smallest tournament size and start tournament
Confirm tournament runs and results display correctly
Select largest tournament size available (e.g. 64 or 128) and start tournament
Verify bracket UI handles large number of foods and animations perform smoothly
Ensure no crashes or rendering issues occur during gameplay
